website_summaries.verdict: Though somewhat expensive, it's a must-have pack of 5 glasses that offer both style and safety for small groups anticipating the upcoming eclipse.
pros: One-size-fits most paper glasses in colorful designs
cons: May fit some smaller individuals a bit loosely

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for watching a solar eclipse!!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we wanted!!! They are simple but do exactly what they say they do. You can adjust the size by folding them in a couple of different spots. Tried them on my 11 year old, 10 year old, 6 year old, and my 4 year old and the glasses fit great for each person.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for great price!
customer_reviews.text: Soluna solar eclipse glasses arrived on time and look just as pictured. The solar safety certifications/regulations are stated on inside of glasses. I tried a pair out by looking directly at the sun through them and my eyes are fine. Looking forward to being able to view the total solar eclipse in August with these glasses. Good price for 10 glasses. The Soluna company emailed me to make sure I was satisfied with my purchase. Nice to see a company providing good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Barb S

customer_reviews.title: Tested this product - works as described. When looking ...
customer_reviews.text: Tested this product - works as described. When looking directly at the sun - solar disk is visible without glare or uncomfortable light intensity. After removing the Solar glasses, there is no visual after-image from a light saturated retina. Should be perfectly safe to view coming eclipse.
customer_reviews.author: Booboy

customer_reviews.title: These glasses are legit
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are legit, which was my primary concern when looking for a pair on amazon. Considering the amount of chinese manufacturers trying to turn a quick buck by cutting corners in every other product category, I was wary of getting some glorified sunglasses by accident. It's one thing to buy some shoddy pajama pants for $5, but quite another to get shoddy eye protection. If you decide on these glasses, make sure that the seller is GSM Sales; if they start selling too well, chances are good some bad knock-offs will start popping up and undercutting the legit version. Stay safe!
customer_reviews.author: Cream Soda

customer_reviews.title: Defective and completely useless
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on June 20 well in advance of next week's eclipse. They've been sitting in a drawer since we got them. Took them out tonight to try them on and saw that ALL 10 pair are bent on the left lens. Some so badly that they're separated from the frame itself, which is a reason to "not use and discard" according to the fine print on the back. I'm super irritated because now it's too late to order replacements through Amazon, everywhere locally is sold out, and I'm past the refund window for these. Should've inspected them more closely when they arrived, shame on me I guess. Totally sucks that our eclipse experience is likely ruined!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: These eclipse sunglasses are FAKE Soluna glasses. There is ...
customer_reviews.text: These eclipse sunglasses are FAKE Soluna glasses. There is a mispelling in the disclaimer (it says "Conforms two" instead of "Conforms to"). And the edges of these glasses are different than the official Soluna sunglasses (edges should be more oval). These are NOT ISO certified and they are NOT Soluna. SHAME ON YOU. You could be causing my family vision imparement. How dare you sell fake equipment. This is dangerous. I will be reporting you.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia Rossato

customer_reviews.title: Potentially unsafe and not certified by the American Astronomical Society
customer_reviews.text: Returning these because I do not see the right ISO number and it is not one of the 5 brands listed as safe by the American Astronomical Society: American Paper Optics Baader Planetarium (in Germany) Rainbow Symphony Thousand Oaks Optical TSE 17 Look for BOTH: 1. Manufacturer Name (For example, American Paper Optics, Rainbow Symphony, Thousand Oaks Optical, Baader Planetarium (AstroSolar Silver/Gold film only), and TSE 17) 2. “ISO” Icon (Must have ISO reference 12312-2). Dash must be in the correct placement. Other tips: 1. If lenses have scratches, don’t use 2. If lenses are wrinkled, not safe for viewing the eclipse 3. If older than 3 years, not recommended
customer_reviews.author: GeeWiz

customer_reviews.title: Small frame, not shading enough light from the sides - blinding eyes
customer_reviews.text: I do not understand the high "star" rating of this thing. The lens are tiny-tiny (material savings?), but what's worse is the the paper bracket surrounding the lens is also tiny, and not blocking enough light. Looking at sun, light reflecting off your face into the back of those glasses (which are white!) and then into your eyes - is blinding. You have to "seal holes" with both my hands to be able to look up. I'm going to take a black sharpie and at least color the insides to reduce reflection. The sun looks like an orange ball (as expected).
customer_reviews.author: greg s

customer_reviews.title: Soluna Eclipse Glasses.
customer_reviews.text: Order these is late July. Went the the NASA Internet site, Soluna/GSM Sales is listed under Online and Other Vendors. Tested these on an incandescent light bulb, could see the filament, then took them outside. The sun appears as a pale orange ball. The instructions include a number of precautions including using these for no more than 3 minutes continuos use. Provided the sun is visible where I live for the eclipse plan to use them August 21st.
customer_reviews.author: Sky Watcher Sam

customer_reviews.title: Sun viewing necessity
customer_reviews.text: Now you can look at the sun and not permanently damage your eyes! They are a more stylish than most of the other paper based glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Just Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit nervous ordering these as there was good and bad feedback, but I went ahead and ordered. The glasses were just as advertised with both the CE and ISO certificates printed on the glasses. Also printed on the glasses was Mfg. name, American Paper Optics and address in TN, USA, and these features give me confidence. Glasses came in perfect condition, rubber bands holding them together in a plastic bag, packed in a small cardboard box with bubble wrap. Perfect, I would recommend these glasses and this seller
customer_reviews.author: extrabilly

customer_reviews.title: These Eclipse Glasses work great.  Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: So far, I have tested these glasses & they seemed to do as described. They have both the ISO, & the CE, along with the address of the manufacturer, as mentioned as the requirement to meet the safety standards for eye protection for viewing the sun. You can Barely see a light bulb or street light, & the sun is perfectly viewable with these glasses even through my phone's camera, & I have not noticed any issues, so far. These seem to be safe glasses for viewing the sun for short periods of times. I purchased these to view the upcoming, August 21st, 2017, Great American Solar Eclipse. I would reccomend these glasses, based on my experience so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: When these arrived my 17 year old son was sceptical ...
customer_reviews.text: When these arrived my 17 year old son was sceptical about them. I assured him that I had read the information about them and that they meet the safety standards and the transmission requirements of ISO 12312-2. I showed him the information on the side of the glasses. He immediately took a pair and went outside with them. He came back in,after looking at the sun with them on, and reported that they work and that his eyes are '"fine". Thank you for a high quality product at an affordable price. Excite to use these for the solar eclipse in August.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon A Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Soluna Solar Eclipse Glasses - CE and ISO Certified Safe ...
customer_reviews.text: Soluna Solar Eclipse Glasses - CE and ISO Certified Safe Shades for Direct Sun Viewing, (10 Pack) These are fake. They are not the glasses pictured, They have all the correct wording, such as ISO certifications and state that they are manufactured by American Paper Optics, but they are fraudulent. I received these today (04Aug2017), and the earpiece shape is incorrect. See this article: (Amazon won't let me post link, but I can provide to anyone interested.) These were marketed as the real deal, and indeed, the glasses in the picture on the listing appear to be so. However, the glasses that I received are not the same as in the picture. I will be returning these knockoffs.
customer_reviews.author: C. Haldeman

customer_reviews.title: Practical and good value.
customer_reviews.text: Basic paper type glasses that come in a flat pack. You bend the corner to provide the ear hooks. The 10 pack was reasonable. It gives me a few extra to hand out to others that my have forgotten theirs when we view the eclipse this August.
customer_reviews.author: David Calder

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: In advance of this year's solar eclipse (Aug 21st 2017) we bought a ten-pack of these. While the eclipse is still a week off, I have "tested" these by looking at the sun with them, and it's quite comfortable. They even fit reasonably well over my glasses. They block 99.999% of light, so basically you can't see anything except an orange-colored ball. I suspect they'll work beautifully for the eclipse. I've also triple-checked the ISO stamp and these are one of the US-based "recommended" companies, so we're all good to go for our party!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Neuwirth

customer_reviews.title: Ready for the eclipse!
customer_reviews.text: Got these in June, so I'm all set! The glasses came in a disposable clear plastic pack. I was able to open it without damaging the pack so I could try out a pair. Went outside and looked at the sun with them on. I saw a bright shiny disc smaller than usual and without the dazzle. Didn't look at it long, maybe 10 seconds or so. When I took the glasses off and looked away, I did NOT see a spot in front of my eyes, which would have happened in just a couple of seconds of looking at the sun without these glasses. These will be great and I'll have my whole crowd covered!
customer_reviews.author: A Mom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solar glasses.
customer_reviews.text: These were terrific for eclipse viewing. They are made in the USA, and are one of the recommendations of the American Astronomical Society. I purchased several packs, and distributed them to family and friends. They are sturdy, made of heavy cardboard. I've saved some used ones for the next eclipse. There is a warning not to walk or move around when wearing these. They are as dark as good welder's glasses. When wearing them, there is no visibility of anything except the sun. If they were any less dark, they would not be of appropriate quality. While the "big" eclipse is over, I do recommend these for any solar viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Knoble

customer_reviews.title: Purchased these for the Great American Eclipse
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for the Great American Eclipse. There was talk about several of these being fake/fraudulent knock offs despite the ANSI/EC printing. Fun fact: did you know that most of these eclipse glasses are time rated? I probably used them longer than the lawyer terms printed on them but I didn't go blind and didn't need to see an eye doctor (it's now almost 1 week post exposure). They are cheap enough to order some for your friends and family (we ordered some for our kids' science class - they loved them!). Do yourself a favor - order and use these. Don't go blind staring at the next 2024 eclipse. Also, don't put sunscreen on your eyes.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hadden

customer_reviews.title: solar eclipse glasses
customer_reviews.text: these are like the 3D glasses you get at the theater. cardboard frames and thin plastic lenses. but they work to look at the coming eclipse. the lenses are appropriate for looking at the eclipse. but remember you can look at the sun for only 2 minutes straight. there is a warning on the glasses about this
customer_reviews.author: Fred Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! We haven't gone blind or had any eye ...
customer_reviews.text: Got these for the upcoming solar eclipse based on the assurances that it is safe to use. My husband and I put on a pair and went straight outside and looked right at the sun. Perfect! We haven't gone blind or had any eye damage and you literally can't see anything except the sun, they are so dark. But you can see the sun very nicely with no harm to the eyes. I am very excited to view the eclipse with my family. This is a great deal for 10 pairs. Be the hero and hand them out to your friends!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy E

customer_reviews.title: Having An Eclipse Party?
customer_reviews.text: O.K., while I have never attended an eclipse party, I paid special attention to the warnings that we should not use unapproved glass or glasses to observe it.... These are an ideal answer, in a pack of 10 so everyone gets to look. They come flat, you fold the bows and hook them over your ears. It will be like those old 3-D movie spectacles, only your cannot see anyone else, they are that dark. I tried them outside and the sun was barely visible, so they should allow us to safely observe the event.
customer_reviews.author: Amaxon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Supply and demand is amazing. The current price is almost 10 times what ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these back in June. The seller was GSM. Someone told me about a recall and I got educated and checked mine. The ones I got from GSM are legit. I was sent another set by a friend that I'm unable to determine the authenticity of. Supply and demand is amazing. The current price is almost 10 times what I paid. I feel really bad for people who are only just now finding out how little China cares about human safety. It's too late to get replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Udell R. Burton

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product
customer_reviews.text: These were fantastic and gave us the best possible experience for watching the eclipse with zero problems during or afterward. The frames are made of cardboard but it's sturdy enough, with a modicum of care, to use for a couple of wearings. And it's strictly one-size fits all, but neither of us (adults) had any trouble with them. I did see people struggling to use similar types with children and would recommend against that. Get the kid size for little people. These are for larger (teen and adult) heads. Great price, very good glasses, and a terrific eclipse experience.
customer_reviews.author: Paradox

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I tested these out on a bright, sunny day and I could see the disk of the sun clearly, but not too bright. The one downside of this style of glasses is that light bleeds around the side of the lenses which is rather bright when looking straight at the bright sun, but not so bad that I can't see. I presume this will be progressively less of an issue as more of the sun is obscured during an eclipse. You definitely need something like this to protect your eyes if you are going to be looking straight at the sun, even when it's almost completely obscured by the moon.
customer_reviews.author: Piper Rucker

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: After comparing pix of the real deal and fakies, I was confident I got the real ones.... So, now I had to see if they work. :-) Taking a leap of faith (or venturing into absolute stupidity) I donned my glasses and looked at the sun. Woot woot!!! They absolutely worked. I do recommend not looking too long because I had sort of like flashbulb spotting after but, I got to look at the sun! Monday is going to be amazing when the femine (moon) completely eclipses the masculine (sun).
customer_reviews.author: Livenjoy

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: I received the certified glasses, but sadly the envelope was folded in half and the glasses were all bent across the left lens. The cardboard at the bottom of the lens is separated on several pairs. There should have been some kind of reinforcement inside the envelope and a Do Not Bend label on the outside. Unfortunately, I don't have time to order and receive replacements before our trip starts, so I will probably return for
customer_reviews.author: Kitzkatz

customer_reviews.title: The dimensions of the lens holder makes them work a bit better for me if place between my eyes and my ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. The solar lenses do the job.Tested them out by looking at the sun with them, and they worked perfectly. I have kind of fiddled with them in terms of how to use them with my glasses. The dimensions of the lens holder makes them work a bit better for me if place between my eyes and my glasses (behind the glasses). Have enough of them to give to my family and anyone on eclipse day who needs a pair.
customer_reviews.author: John W2000

customer_reviews.title: Better to have too many than too few
customer_reviews.text: My cousin had the same bright idea as I did and also bought a multi-pack of these to the eclipse-viewing gathering. Better to have too many than too few, hey? It was a marvelous event, and everyone was able to safely view the eclipse from start to finish. We keep the extras in the car and house, since it is the only safe way to look at the sun. Amazing that it allows one to see the sun through cloud cover.
customer_reviews.author: Sony

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait for 8/21/17
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the upcoming Solar Eclipse on 8/21/17. I bought the 10 pack so my wife and I could share with coworkers. I used a pair to look directly at the sun, and it's amazing! The sun becomes a small yellow circle. These will protect our eyes and allow us to witness this natural phenomenon safely.
customer_reviews.author: KJH

customer_reviews.title: Good Souvenir At Worst
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for an upcoming event. No solar eclipse test runs are practical between now and August 21. Since such occasions are infrequent this will likely become a souvenir at some point to be unceremoniously discarded. Everything suggests they are single purpose. Ten pack nicely packaged. Some assembly in the way of folding to fit face is in order. Arrival via Amazon prime was prompt.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth cater

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: The 10-pack of glasses I received are fake and after reading recent reviews I am throwing them away. While they look okay at first glance, TO is spelled incorrectly as TWO and instead of saying RAYS they say RACE. Please, double check that you have the legit glasses if you've purchased these.
customer_reviews.author: wezhorst

customer_reviews.title: NASA approved. Look great
customer_reviews.text: The eclipse hasn't happened yet, so I'll try to remember to update this once it has. The glasses came, on time and they look great- good quality and all. I read an article about how not all the eclipse glasses being sold are not NASA approved. These are. We live in the eclipse path, pretty excited about all this. Knowing these are approved and won't hurt mine or kids while using them is a great comfort.
customer_reviews.author: karsum

customer_reviews.title: USA made, ISO and CE certified, Good Value
customer_reviews.text: At $1.70 per pair, these were just a little more costly than some of the other available options, but well worth it for peace of mind.. Each pair has the ISO and CE certification marks, and shows they are made by American Paper Optics in the USA -- no worries about knock-offs or inferior imports. The 10 pairs were bundled together flat in one plastic wrap, not individual sleeves, but arrived undamaged and ready to go with a couple of quick folds at the corners. The design is understated, not over-the-top gaudy, which I like. I did a quick test outside, and yep, everything was dark except for a small orange sun. Very satisfied with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Gma

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you read all the information
customer_reviews.text: First glasses I ordered could not be used as not certified. Thank you Amazon for refunding my money as I had already sent glasses out to relatives. Thank God we did not all use as ordered 10 pair. I reordered the one pictured after hearing warnings on TV and looking for the proper kind to use. These worked, but a little flimsy to use. Needed bigger coverage for the eyes. I used two hands to make sure glasses covered my eyes snugly. Good price. No one went blind. Amen.
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: HUGE RIPOFF!!!
customer_reviews.text: Would give less than 1 star if it was an option. Purchased and paid for 2 sets of 10 glasses. Product description states they are ISO certified and include rating and instructions printed on glasses. Instead of 20 glasses - I received 6. In addition, they are not certified or have any writing on them at all. I only purchased these after I read reviews, which were good and thought I was safe as they have a 4.5 star rating. Don't know how or why the quality changed, but the quantity is a REAL issue!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly H.

customer_reviews.title: Solar Glassess
customer_reviews.text: I feel really lucky to reside in the direct path of the eclipse, a once in a lifetime event. Which means that I want to share this experience with others making sure that they safely watch this event and not need expensive glasses that I could not ever use again in another 99 years. These glasses remind me of old 3D glasses and certainly will last through the eclipse.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: fake! Rays is spelled "race" on the glasses and ...
customer_reviews.text: fake! Rays is spelled "race" on the glasses and if you go on Solunas website they will tell you how to tell if they are authentic and these are not. If they don't have a website link to Soluna on the bridge of the nose they are fake also. The website tells you more. These failed and are fake. Thanks Rix Beauty. Need to be taken off Amazon. I did call Amazon who did refund me thankfully.
customer_reviews.author: CAMETYEM

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Our children and grand children came over to see the eclipse. Protected our eyes and allowed us to view the eclipse. We did have to hold them in place as they would not stay in position like regular glasses do. I don't imaging there is a lot of use for them until the next eclipse, but since there is a 3 year shelf life and I will probably forget where I've put them, for us they are a one use item. Very reasonably priced for the safe eclipse viewing.
customer_reviews.author: H S.

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my family to view the Aug. 21, 2017 total eclipse in the US. They worked perfectly (unlike so many fake brands that, very sadly, damaged some folks' eyes). These were near perfect and quite affordable (we even gave a few pairs away at the last minute, because we had fewer in our party than we'd thought). I am very grateful that these wonderful glasses allowed my family to safely share this amazing, humbling event.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Lab tested - these are the real deal.
customer_reviews.text: I'd read articles about the presence of counterfeits and didn't want worry to plague my family's eclipse experience. Fortunately, I work in the optical field and asked a friend in R&D to test the ones I ordered for me. Good news! The ones I ordered on Amazon from GSM Sales work as they should, blocking all UV light and allowing less than 0.01% of visible light through (though it may be lower - the data get a little noisy at such low levels of transmission). After this test, I put the glasses on and looked directly at the sun and it was completely comfortable. I am confident putting them on my family for the eclipse.
customer_reviews.author: Flerg Hergersen

customer_reviews.title: These are the safe kind. 👍
customer_reviews.text: These are the real certified safe glasses. I was concerned when I saw different news channels reporting that many glasses being sold weren't safe for the eclipse but they mentioned the numbers to look for to check if what you had was safe. Thankfully these are the good ones! We are excited for the upcoming solar eclipse on August 21st as we are in the path of totality.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Krull

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but effective
customer_reviews.text: Certified safe. Impressive communication from the company during the scare over counterfeit eclipse glasses during the Aug 2017 eclipse. Flimsy but what does one expect from solar eclipse glasses made for one time use? Overpricing is the reason I'm giving 4 instead of 5 stars. No way these cost anywhere near $8 each to produce and distribute. Guess the company has to make its money when it can but this is close to price gouging.
customer_reviews.author: CO

customer_reviews.title: The glasses were perfect. Looking forward to 2024 in Maine
customer_reviews.text: We drove 6 hrs to Aiken SC , stayed overnight, and viewed the total eclipse that day. The glasses were perfect. Looking forward to 2024 in Maine. We bought a 10 pack and gave away 8 to neighbors with 6 children. We watched the news and was informed that during "totality" the glasses can be removed. It made a huge difference. The moment the sun started coming back, then put the glasses back on. It was an amazing experience.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Seemed very functional. Go see an eclipse.
customer_reviews.text: They worked well. No one went blind. EVERYONE LOVED THE ECLIPSE! We managed to be nearly right in the middle of the path for the Great American Eclipse of 2017, over 2 minutes of totality. Entire group considered it a life changing experience. They were delivered quickly in a time when the glasses were in short supply. All of ours were donated to astronomers without borders following the eclipse.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: I'm not blind yet.
customer_reviews.text: I looked at the eclipse and didn't go blind. Seems my careful planning paid off because I had these when everyone else was trying to find them (buy early!) and even made money by selling a few. Plus, they were genuine and kept myself and my kids safe while we enjoyed a fascinating astrological phenomenon.
customer_reviews.author: Hectate

customer_reviews.title: Once in lifetime viewing!
customer_reviews.text: The glasses did the job. We were so thankful to find glasses on short notice that allowed us to view the amazing eclipse. After we were warned not to use our first order from a different company due to an inability to verify their certification claims, we didn't know if there would be time to get a safe pair of glasses for viewing this once in a lifetime event. Thankfully, we found these glasses which I was able to cross reference with the NASA approved list. Thanks to Amazon Prime, we had them in two days and were ready for the big event.
customer_reviews.author: kbkealford

customer_reviews.title: The real deal
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. Have already tested and the only thing visible through these is the sun. Used seller GSM Sales. See pics, including pic of the sun!

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our group that is going to travel from Minnesota to Nebraska to experience the total solar eclipse in August. Tested them out by using them to look directly at the sun and it was so cool! I am sure they are going to be perfect for the purpose they were made. Fast shipping; customer service extremely professional! Rare to find a business that is so invested in it's customers. Bravo to them!

customer_reviews.author: MrsKermit

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about scams ordering these so close to the recent eclipse but when they came in I was happy to find that they were legit. I liked the pack of 10 because it allowed me to give a few pairs away to my family and had some left over to share with coworkers on the day of the eclipse. They felt fairly well-made. Shipping was fast so I received them in time to enjoy the eclipse. Coworkers and I had a ball using them to watch the event.
customer_reviews.author: Annie G.

customer_reviews.title: These glasses are recommended by NASA for eclipse viewing
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are recommended by NASA for eclipse viewing. NASA issued a warning July 20th, 2017 that unsafe eclipse glasses are being distributed by “unscrupulous companies.” The space agency recommends only using eclipse glasses with ISO 12312-2 printed on them that have been printed by the four following companies: American Paper Optics, Rainbow Symphony, Thousand Oaks Optical, and TSE 17.
customer_reviews.author: man ely

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Looks like counterfeit product! There is a typo in the first sentence ... "Conforms TWO" rather than "Conforms TO and meets Transmission Requirements of ISO 12312-2..." Also the shape of the glasses is boxy, less rounded than product depicted on manufacturer's website! Do not recommend buying solar eclipse glasses from Rix Beauty
customer_reviews.author: Linda V

customer_reviews.title: I can still see
customer_reviews.text: The eclipse was a couple of years ago and we didn’t go blind so I guess they work perfectly! I don’t have these anymore. So can’t speak to long term sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: Pammy

customer_reviews.title: These glasses are perfect. Of course the eclipse hasn't happened yet but ...
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are perfect. Of course the eclipse hasn't happened yet but I put them on outside and looked directly at the sun. Couldn't see anything but the dot of the sun. Looking forward to August 21. Came perfectly packaged and arrived on time. Highly recommend if you're looking for some glasses to view the eclipse.
customer_reviews.author: mzm35

customer_reviews.title: Amazing price!
customer_reviews.text: CE and ISO certified. Took them out and looked at the sun on a clear day and could only see a small orange dot, exactly what you want to protect your eyes. Amazing price and great quality. The lens has a nice silver tint to it which looks very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jake S

customer_reviews.title: Amazon was wonderful for accepting the return of this product and reimbursing ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazon was wonderful for accepting the return of this product and reimbursing our cost. We were worried that there was a possibility that these glasses were counterfeits as there was a typographical error on the right inside ear piece and the lenses were not the same density and quality as the lenses in the replacement glasses we purchased.
customer_reviews.author: klc999

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so my whole family would be protected. I didn't want to spend a lot of money since this would be a one time use. I put a pair on inside and I couldn't see a thing. I took them out and looked directly at the sun. I could see the sun and it was comfortable to look at with the glasses on. They are one size fits all so with children I think you would need to be cautious and make sure the are wearing them properly.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: They worked for the eclipse
customer_reviews.text: I guess these worked because we can all see and I didn't get a refund for them. More than we needed so we shared them with neighbors who, at the last minute, decided they wanted to look (we were in the 98% elipse zone) but couldn't find glasses anywhere. The package had ten and we needed only two. I was glad to have extras to hand out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: really only useful for looking directly at the sun
customer_reviews.text: They are kind of limited for use. They work as advertised for observing a solar eclipse, but not much else. I've tried welding with them, they are too dark. I tried looking at my LED headlight diodes, they are too dark. I tried driving with them(which I do not recommend), they are too dark. They are pretty much too dark for anything other than looking directly at the sun.
customer_reviews.author: TOP

customer_reviews.title: Not a valuable product misleading!
customer_reviews.text: These were not as described and actually we could not use them so sad. I still have the opened bag that I bought for my family as we drove to the mountains of North Carolina to see the lunar eclipse july 2018 but we didnt use our glasses. We paid a stranger an outrageous amount of money for ones that actually worked!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Wreden-Sadeq

customer_reviews.title: i paid a lot of money for these Certified glasses ...
customer_reviews.text: i paid a lot of money for these Certified glasses. Come to find out they were selling the same thing at a local gas station for one dollar per pair. My fault really. I should have researched. Another eclipse in 2024... I will be at the gas station buying glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Dbygrem

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find my other ones so I bought these for a Mercury transit that occurred (though I only needed one pair), unfortunately I wasn't able to see it with just the glasses, I needed a telescope or binoculars. Maybe I can use them for looking at the Sun or other solar related phenomenons.
customer_reviews.author: PeachCobblestone

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these glasses last minute from GSM sales. Was very concerned and did a lot of research on counterfeit glasses. After ordering I read some of the reviews and see a lot of people posted that they received counterfeit so I became very weary as to what I purchased.Received these today on time as promised and they are the real deal nothing counterfeit. anybody wanting to order from this company rest assured you're getting your moneys worth
customer_reviews.author: Kmik

customer_reviews.title: Safe and work well
customer_reviews.text: Was really concerned with safety so checked every avenue to verify manufacturer and seller. All indications said good so ... I took the plunge and did the ultimate test and looked at the sun with them. Well, I'm happy to report I can still see and have no spots in front of my eyes. Looking forward to the eclipse - I'll be at 99.1% viewing angle.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Creased lens
customer_reviews.text: Received them with a creased right eye lens. The entire bundle has the crease, so I do not believe it was because of shipping as the crease is the same on all of them.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: NOT on NASA's List of Approved Safe Glasses
customer_reviews.text: I'm leaving a one star review to warn people that this company is not on the list of approved producers of glasses by NASA, AAS, or NOAA as producers of safe glasses. The only companies who have been approved are the following: "To date four manufacturers have certified that their eclipse glasses and handheld solar viewers meet the ISO 12312-2 international standard for such products: Rainbow Symphony, American Paper Optics, Thousand Oaks Optical, and TSE 17." I would not take the chance with my eyesight on glasses not proven to be effective by the experts. Plus there are several other reviews indicating these are made in China.
customer_reviews.author: JerseyKim

customer_reviews.title: 10 pack was like only a buck more than 4
customer_reviews.text: 10 pack was like only a buck more than 4. I'll bring them all to the event to make sure others have them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Brady

customer_reviews.title: These are the REAL DEAL ISO and CE CERTIFIED
customer_reviews.text: These are the REAL DEAL, ISO and CE certified. I was worried after the Amazon recall on solar eclipse glasses. But mine arrived in 2 days, and I checked them looking right at the sun and they worked GREAT! I only needed 4 pairs and sold the other 6 before they even arrived! Highly recommend this seller!
customer_reviews.author: Chantay Foley

customer_reviews.title: They were great
customer_reviews.text: These luckily were not affected by the recall! I used these for my six kids and myself to watch the Eclipse. I had to improvise for the little kids using a paper plate and string but it worked. I also used one of these lenses to cover the camera lense on my phone so I could take pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Hiswife22

customer_reviews.title: If authentic, the item seems to be the right product for the eclipse.
customer_reviews.text: This product has printed information reassuring me that this is the right product to use the day of the eclipse: mfg by American Paper Optics, ISO 12312-2 as recommended by NASA. I have yet to try them by looking directly at the sun and although not the product's fault, I am giving it four stars until testing them.
customer_reviews.author: WilliamO

customer_reviews.title: These glasses proved very effective for the recent solar eclipse ...
customer_reviews.text: These glasses proved very effective for the recent solar eclipse. The grandkids and adults all found them of value. Even though scattered clouds made viewing difficult, the glasses seemed to make observation through the lighter overcast. I'd buy again, but doubt the opportunity to observe another solar eclipse.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good (& safe) for solar observation
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect for the 2017 North American eclipse. Didn't go blind, so that's nice. There are glasses that had larger and clearer lenses but oh well, these worked fine. Stowing a pair in the glovebox for future use. Will see how they hold up (of course won't use if damaged...)
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: I can still see...
customer_reviews.text: I watched the eclipse for more than an hour. Was on the path of totality. I still have my vision, so I am assuming they worked perfectly. They fit over my glasses, were pretty comfortable. Was a little paranoid the thin lens was going to get scratched or ripped, and the cardboard frame is not super sturdy. But that's the tradeoff for an inexpensive glass!
customer_reviews.author: David Merz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Viewing!
customer_reviews.text: Not only were these glasses an awesome way to view the eclipse, I used the lens from one to make a filter for my micro 4/3 camera and got a sharp, clear picture of the totality. Holding a lens over the phone's camera lens also gave me great pictures (when I had the camera settings right). Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Something Else

customer_reviews.title: Allows you to stare at sun without getting blind
customer_reviews.text: They have the ISO 12312-2 certification and work great! Makes everything super dim, so the sun is nice and comfy to stare at while wearing these. I used these to watch the August 21, 2017 solar eclipse, and it worked perfectly -- at least, I'm not blind yet after the event nor observe any noticeable permanent eye damage, so I'm giving it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, safe, cheap
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Comes with 2 sizes so you should fold on one of then. Look direct sun for 10 minutes without any problem, provides high protection level. I'm waiting to use them on Chile Total Eclipse.
customer_reviews.author: E. Villagran M

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 10 to take with me to Qatar for the December eclipse; friends were joining me there. Also used these for the US eclipse of a few years ago. Easy to travel with and they terrifically handle looking at the sun during all phases, or no phase. Just be careful about looking at the sun when not in total eclipse for more than 3 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: JMW

customer_reviews.title: Family and friends enjoyed the 80% solar eclipse safely
customer_reviews.text: Family and friends enjoyed the 80% solar eclipse safely. Look forward to the next eclipse and ordering another 10 pairs. Reasonable price and shipping costs. [The mylar film with the sunblock breaks down within a short period so you do not want to reuse those bought this year for a future eclipse event. There is a warning in the "glasses" about is shelf life.]
customer_reviews.author: PC, Philadelphia

customer_reviews.title: Good, safe product
customer_reviews.text: These were great for the August 2017 solar eclipse. They were the approved, properly marked kind. I had them for a bunch of kids and felt confident to let them use them. I bought them months ahead of time and was glad I did, as they were selling out everywhere by the first week of August.
customer_reviews.author: Cece Not-So-Usual

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: We received the 10 pack of glasses back in July 2017. (To confirm, I received the legitimate ones!) My family and friends used these glasses during the 2017 NA solar eclipse and they worked perfectly! No eye damage. We could clearly see the disc shape of the moon crossing the sun. We will hold onto these for future use.
customer_reviews.author: Starfall

customer_reviews.title: Just what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. We weren't able to find Eclipse Glasses before the last eclipse but since we know we will be in the path of the next one we decided to go ahead and order some now. Looked at the sun when they arrived and they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda H.

customer_reviews.title: Waiting for the Aug. eclipse...
customer_reviews.text: Received these quickly. Can't wait to test these out on the solar eclipse in August. I live in SC right in line of the Aug eclipse. Wanted to be sure to get a good brand especially since my grandbabies will be using these.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what is described
customer_reviews.text: So, last eclipse I did not have these and they were sold out of everything everywhere. I bought them way way in advance for the next one. I cannot attest to how they work at this point, but they are exactly as described at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Trish C

customer_reviews.title: I watched the August 2017 Eclipse.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. I watched the Eclipse. 2. It was awesome. 3. I can still see. Cons: I'll never get to use them again.
customer_reviews.author: 3J

customer_reviews.title: But when you look towards the sun you see it clearly and comfortably. It's actually pretty neat
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in preparation of the 2017 total solar eclipse. I got the 10x pack to give out to friends for safe viewing. When you put them on you can't see anything through the lenses - just blackness. But when you look towards the sun you see it clearly and comfortably. It's actually pretty neat. Construction and materials seem high quality. I feel confident that they will protect my eyes from harmful solar rays.
customer_reviews.author: Brad S.

customer_reviews.title: Astronomy Teacher Approved!
customer_reviews.text: These are actually safe - recommended by NASA and the American Astronomical Society. Unlike most of what I've seen in stores (in the path of the eclipse, so everyone's jumping on the bandwagon), these actually have met the required safety standards. I recommended these to my astronomy students and bought them for my family!
customer_reviews.author: Kristie B.

customer_reviews.title: Eye protection for viewing solar eclipse
customer_reviews.text: These seem very sturdy and well made. They seem like they would absolutely hold up for the entire eclipse. They will be used by the kids and adults in the neighborhood on the 21st of August so they need to fit all sizes. The youngest is 9, the oldest is 65 and the glasses seem to work for both.
customer_reviews.author: ruthy rowdy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Feel confident in the protection as they are ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Feel confident in the protection as they are made in the USA and are certified. Jumped in price from 2 days ago but they work really well and I gave most of my first order away. Enjoyed testing them out by watching clouds move across the sun today. Can hardly wait for th eclipse.
customer_reviews.author: DKS

customer_reviews.title: These paper glasses were very useful, but not for prolonged use either
customer_reviews.text: Me and my family were in Charleston, SC at the time of the eclipse this summer. These paper glasses were very useful, but not for prolonged use either. They are just to be used once, but so cheap that we could distribute them on the beach if someone needed one.
